titleStmt.title: The womens sharpe revenge: or an answer to Sir Seldome Sober that writ those railing pamphelets called the Iuniper and Crabtree lectures, &c. Being a sound reply and a full confutation of those bookes: with an apology in this case for the defence of us women. Performed by Mary Tattle-well, and Ioane Hit-him-home, spinsters.
titleStmt.author: Tattle-well, Mary.

titleStmt.title: The womens sharpe revenge: or an answer to Sir Seldome Sober that writ those railing pamphelets called the Iuniper and Crabtree lectures, &c. Being a sound reply and a full confutation of those bookes: with an apology in this case for the defence of us women. Performed by Mary Tattle-well, and Ioane Hit-him-home, spinsters.
titleStmt.author: Tattle-well, Mary.
Hit-him-home, Ioane. aut
Taylor, John, 1580-1653. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: By I. O[kes] and are to be sold by Ia. Becket at his shop in the inner Temple-gate,

notesStmt.note: Mary Tattle-well and Ioane Hit-him home are pseudonyms; "This answer may have been written by John Taylor as well as the two works it attacks"--STC.
Imperfect; lacks final leaf (leaves?) of "The table, and heads of this book", and all after page 214.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
